name: The Royal Society of Edinburgh
goal:
The Royal Society of Edinburgh is Scotland's National Academy. Founded in 1783, the RSE currently has over 1600 Fellows, with some of the best intellectual talent in academia, the professions and business, based in Scotland, the UK and beyond. The expertise within the Fellowship spans science and technology, arts, humanities, social science, business and public service. Drawing on this diversity and always acting with impartiality, the RSE facilitates public debate, research programmes, educational projects and strategy formulation, providing public benefit throughout Scotland.

The Society's unique multi-disciplinary approach enables it to draw from and link with a broad spectrum of expertise to advance the understanding of globally-important issues. In fulfilling its Royal Charter for the 'advancement of learning and useful knowledge', the RSE seeks to contribute to the social, cultural and economic wellbeing of Scotland.

The RSE is an educational charity, registered in Scotland, operating on a wholly independent and non-party-political basis.
